Lying in bed sick but still actively talking on the phone to manage the case and reassure the client.

Drags herself into the office despite feeling weary and wanting to take a sick day.

Worried about the case and her family, but still decides to take her kids for a ride to stay engaged.

Distractedly tries to watch TV but is unable to sit still, indicating restlessness and focus on the case.

Picks up rejected release forms and decides to make 635 copies to distribute despite the meeting falling apart.
Observes the meeting falling apart and gets visibly frustrated, showing emotional investment but no immediate solution.

Gives George his own motel room and money, showing care and consideration.
Warns George not to take her kids on his bike and offers to pay for a cab, showing protective concern.

Admits to having treated George badly and acknowledges the tension, showing emotional awareness but potentially risking personal relationships that could affect her support system.

Forces herself awake to maintain control over her car and responsibilities despite exhaustion.
